answers.answer: chelly, how many weeks are you again?

Chelly,As your doctor to take you off work entirely, explain the situation and that cutting back hours isn't an option, and hopefully they can do that.  I know that mine didn't take me off fully till this last issue I had, just said that until my employer can't accomodate me anymore then I should work...

i definitely would not continue working that many hours. especially since you already have signs of preeclampsia and at 28 weeks. my obsessive research on the topic has told me that preeclampsia can progress quickly, and can be dangerous to the babies and to you. 2 weeks ago, i didn't have any symptoms... now we're watching carefully to see how long it's safe to wait to deliver. if i were you, i would speak to the dr about going out on disability (although i'm surprised he's not insisting on it already...). if he's unwilling, then you may have to suck it up and deal with the lack of income. chances are, within a couple of weeks, he'd clear you for disability. i know it's terrifying to think about the money, but your health and the babie's health is a priority.

I would ask your doctor to take you out.  My b/p has not gone down in a few weeks either but for whatever reason my doctor doesn't see a problem with this.  You are carrying twins though.  Way different.  I think you should defineately explain your situation and hopefully they will let you stop working.  You don't want to have to deliver too early...

28 weeks and 2 days. due October 3rd.3 weeks ago i had early signs of pre-e(pitting edema, blurred vision, headaches, hbp and nausea) and he started watching me weekly2 weeks ago the hbp was stable and my edema had reduced from my knees down to just my feetlast week my hbp was back but no protein was present yetyesterday i had trace protein, hbp and pitting edema from my knees down. none in my hands yet, but they are tingly and my face is swollen but not pitting.he said the 4 hours a day thing to see if my job was stressing me. (it's not. i have a desk job that affords me 7 or so hours of playing online with about 2 hours of legitimate work)he also said that next week or the following would be my last he was sure. (at work anyways) and that there was pretty much no chance i would make it past september to deliver if i am lucky. very lucky.his plan has been (so he told me yesterday)reduce hours to halfthen home bed restthen hospital bed restthen delivery

You have a very good doctor.My only additional suggestion is to spend virtually all your time when you are not at work laying on your side.  I mean it.  The left side may be a bit better than the right, but you can lay on either.  Do not lay on your back, and keep your feet elevated as much as possible.This is very serious at your gestational age, and you will almost certainly be taken out of work very soon for the duration.Start making whatever arrangements you need to for complete bedrest either at home or in the hospital.  You will not be cooking or cleaning at home, so have a plan ready.Best of luck, keep us informed.

I'd ask your dr to take you out of working completely...Especially with twins....28 weeks.  A woman here at my work left at 32 weeks...no one questioned it.You can't really and I'm sure if you have a good dr....He'll do it...it's really a small request and to be honest....I'm surprised he didn't suggest that.
No advice.  Just wanted to let you know I was thinking of you.Good luck!

Just curious...If you are allowed 12 weeks post partum....why would you go back after 8?I'm just curious because I am protected under FMLA and I was worried that if I was taking out early...(which I may be)....I wouldn't still get the 12 weeks post partum?I'm allowed 26 weeks in a 12 month rolling period.
Your labs have been normal, right?  Do you have a home BP machine? If not, I'd recommend getting one.
thanks :) that's always nice to hear!ironically i expected to feel much worse than i do with this.

Years ago, they used to put pre-eclamptic women on severely salt restricted diets.  It has not been shown to be of any use.  If you only eat whats in normal foods, you're fine with your intake.The 24hr urine will help a lot--if you're spilling a lot of protein, you'll be out of work asap, and possibly in the hospital.  Its concerning that your LFTs are getting a bit out of whack, too.  It sounds to me like your doc is being very thorough and watching everything as he should.
NO earth shattering advice, I think peek covered it all ( and yes Peek I AM wearing my t-shirt)I would go off on full disability......
there should be a market for those shirts :)
I think they're on eBay now, Lol.Don't worry, plenty of people despise me.  Its all good.

eh, people will always despise someone who tells it like it is. unless you sugar coat every word that ever comes out of your mouth it will happen.i prefer the blunt truth to a nice lie any day.those people who hate hearing what you have to say are always back to "vent" about how mean and imcompetent their doctors are for saying the same thing.maybe there ought to be "peek is my hero" pacifiers for those people?!

thanks so much.i was really hoping you miht give me your opinion.my S/O already does most of the cooking and cleaning. he attends my appointments with me and takes the doctors advice very serious.i can't lie on my back if i wanted to. lol.i am going to talk to my employer and see if i can work somethign out to benefit us both. i am also going to tell them that i will probably be out of the office within the next two weeks and gone until my babies are 8 weeks old. (great benefits at my company allow me to take up till 12 weeks post partum)if i am on full bedrest my situation won't be so bad. we have no children to care for at home or anything, he'll(SO) just be fending for himself. this 'tween time is the hardest.thankfully i have the best work environment with very understanding employers.

deann- it's a private policy here at my company. i work for a small 25 or less employee type construction company. it is family owned and very pleasant.i negotiated my own leave. they agreed to give me 12 weeks postpartum unless i had to take early leave. then they agreed to 8 weeks postpartum unless my doctor said i needed longer. i am going to be paid 66% of my usual salary the whole time i am out. but, they need me. i  am the only one trained to do the scematics that i do, so there will be a costly temp filling my shoes while i am out.by law 12 weeks is it. which is pretty cruddy. i think almost every other country gives much longer.peek- my labs had been normal.last week i had slightly elevated lft. not sure if that is related. they drew them again yesterday. he's watching my lft and kidneys something.  sunday i have to do a 24 hour urine sample and bring it with me monday to my gd test. does cutting salt out have an impact at this point? i was told to watch it before, but i have never been a salt user. just what's is in normal foods.
I think Stephnewmom will  not be buying a T-Shirt.
I think that peek is a great asset to this site.  I always look forward to her advice!   I'm too fat to fit into a tee shirt though

question: i saw the doctor yesterday. he re-checked me for the preeclampsia. my blood pressure was 140/96!!! and it would not go down. my iron was 10.6. i had trace sugar in my urine and trace protein in my urine too. i gained 5 pounds this month for a total of 25 pounds at 28 weeks.the girls were super active...as usual and hard to get heart tones on. once they pinned them down by poking one side to sorta force them into one spot. the rates were 150 and 158.they are good i am not so much. i also have torn ligaments in my groin!!!owwies. the problem is my doctor said no more 9 hour work days for me since my pre-e is not stable at all and getting worse. he wants me to cut down to 4 hours a day. the problem is at 4 hours i am hourly and making less than half my usual income!!! if i were to get put on full disability i would get 66% of my wages.do i ask the doctor to take me out all together or do i break his wishes and work like normal? making half of my income is pretty much not an optiongd testing repeat Monday. wish me luck :)
